009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.subtract;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * Vector simplified version with greatly reduced memory requirements.
020 * This code is based on the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed by Perona and Malik,
021 * as proposed in Pietro Perona and Jitendra Malik, "Scale-space and edge detection 
022 * using anisotropic diffusion", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis 
023 * and Machine Intelligence, vol. 12, no. 4, pp. 629-639 (July 1990).
024 * 
025 * The filter operates on all types of grayscale (scalar) and RGB color images.
026 * This class is based on the ImageJ API and intended to be used in ImageJ plugins.
027 * How to use: consult the source code of the related ImageJ plugins for examples.
028 * 
029 * @author W. Burger
030 * @version 2021/01/04
031 */     
032public class PeronaMalikFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements PeronaMalikF {
033        
034        private final float alpha;
035        private final int T;            // number of iterations
036        private final ConductanceFunction g;
037        private ColorMode colorMode;
038        
039        // constructor - using default parameters
040        public PeronaMalikFilterVector () {
041                this(new Parameters());
042        }
043        
044        // constructor - use this version to set all parameters
045        public PeronaMalikFilterVector (Parameters params) {
046                this.T = params.iterations;
047                this.alpha = (float) params.alpha;
048                this.g = ConductanceFunction.get(params.conductanceFunType, (float)params.kappa);
049                this.colorMode = params.colorMode;
050        }
051        
052        // ------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        @Override
055        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
056                /*   
057                 *  NH pixels:      directions:
058                 *      p4              3
059                 *   p3 p0 p1         2 x 0
060                 *      p2              1
061                 */
062                float[][] A = new float[4][];   // p[i][k]: 4 pixel colors from the 3x3 neigborhood
063                float[] Ac =  pack.getVec(u, v);
064//              A[0] = pack.getVec(u, v);
065                A[0] = pack.getVec(u + 1, v);
066                A[1] = pack.getVec(u, v - 1);
067                A[2] = pack.getVec(u - 1, v);
068                A[3] = pack.getVec(u, v + 1);
069                
070                float[] result = Ac.clone(); //A[0].clone();
071                
072                switch (colorMode) {
073                case BrightnessGradient:
074                        float bc = getBrightness(Ac);
075                        for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
076                                float bi = getBrightness(A[i]);
077                                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
078                                        float gi = g.eval(Math.abs(bi - bc));
079                                        result[k] = result[k] + alpha * gi * (A[i][k] - Ac[k]);
080                                }
081                        }
082                        break;
083                case ColorGradient:
084                        for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
085                                float[] D = subtract(A[i], Ac);
086                                float gi = g.eval(Matrix.normL2(D));    // g applied to color gradient magnitude
087                                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
088                                        result[k] = result[k] + alpha * gi * D[k];
089                                }
090                        }
091                        break;
092                default:
093                        throw new RuntimeException("color mode option " + colorMode.name() +
094                                        " not implemented in class " + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
095                }
096                
097                return result;
098        }
099
100        @Override
101        protected final int passesRequired() {
102                return T;       // this filter needs T passes
103        }
104        
105        private final float getBrightness(float[] p) {
106                return 0.299f * p[0] + 0.587f * p[1] + 0.114f * p[2];
107        }
108        
109}
